decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to maintain a fast pace and aggressive approach, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. With cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to consistently apply pressure and force the opponent to react defensively. The burn spells like Chain Lightning, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt serve as direct damage sources to close out the game, while Price of Progress can punish opponents for playing non-basic lands. Overall, this deck aims to win through a combination of creature attacks and direct damage spells.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's deck quickly and win the game. The deck includes a variety of red cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also including cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon to restrict their mana base. The deck also includes cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, the Great Creator for additional value and versatility in gameplay. By assembling the combo pieces and controlling the board, the deck aims to secure a quick and decisive victory.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures, like Changeling Outcast and Ornithopter, to consistently trigger Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow's ability to deal damage and draw cards. Utilizing ninja creatures like Ingenious Infiltrator, along with disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze, allows for control over the game while maintaining aggressive pressure. The deck also includes artifacts like Retrofitter Foundry for additional value. The goal is to quickly establish a board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy, ultimately overwhelming them with efficient creatures and card advantage.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Merfolk Aggro deck is to swarm the board with powerful Merfolk creatures such as True-Name Nemesis and Lord of Atlantis, boosted by lord effects like Merfolk Mistbinder and Master of the Pearl Trident. Using Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to cheat creatures into play and protect them with countermagic like Force of Will and Daze, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. With a strong mana base and disruptive elements like Merfolk Trickster, this deck is designed to be fast and relentless in its attacks.

The main focus of this Legacy Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly play disruptive and powerful cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Ensnaring Bridge to stifle opponents' strategies and lock them out of the game. With a combination of mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, along with aggressive threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Legion Warboss, the deck aims to establish early board presence and control the game through disruptive elements. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, the Great Creator to further pressure opponents and provide additional utility. This deck capitalizes on fast mana and powerful lock pieces to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Karn, the Great Creator and Power Artifact to generate infinite mana and use Walking Ballista to deal lethal damage to the opponent. It includes a mix of card selection, counterspells, and mana acceleration to help dig for combo pieces and protect the combo once assembled. The deck runs a low land count and includes snow-covered islands to support the fetch lands, with City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb providing additional fast mana sources.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck uses a combination of cards like Elvish Reclaimer, Crop Rotation, and Vampire Hexmage to tutor for and protect the combo pieces. It also includes cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize for disruption and graveyard synergy with cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck aims to win the game swiftly through the powerful synergy and combo potential of the Dark Depths archetype in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures like Thalia and Sanctum Prelate, while applying pressure with efficient threats like Stoneforge Mystic and Batterskull. Utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and control the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. This deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements, aiming to control the game and secure victory through incremental advantage and resource denial.

The deck focuses on efficiently generating mana and creating a large storm count to win the game in a single turn. This is achieved through cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Chrome Mox to accelerate mana production, while spells like Ponder and Brainstorm help find key pieces. Burning Wish acts as both a tutor and win condition, allowing the player to search for specific cards such as Empty the Warrens or Ad Nauseam. The inclusion of Thoughtseize and Defense Grid also helps protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of Sliver creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing cards like Crystalline Sliver to protect the Sliver creatures and Aether Vial to cheat them into play, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence that is difficult to deal with. With a mix of creatures that provide different abilities and support cards like Force of Will for protection, the deck is able to adapt to different situations and maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the game.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll, Golgari Thug, and Stinkweed Imp using cards like Breakthrough and Faithless Looting. Once your graveyard is filled, you can use cards like Ichorid and Narcomoeba to bring back creatures and generate token creatures with Bridge from Below. With the ability to sacrifice creatures for value with Cabal Therapy and potentially bring out an early Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, this deck aims to overwhelm and outvalue opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on using artifacts and cost reduction effects to generate mana quickly and draw through the deck with Narset, Parter of Veils and Riddlesmith. By chaining spells and generating mana, the deck can combo off with Grapeshot or Brain Freeze to mill the opponent's library or deal lethal damage. Defense Grid protects the combo from disruption, while Echo of Eons provides a way to refill the hand and continue the combo. The deck aims to win the game in one explosive turn while maintaining control of the game through disruptive elements.

The main strategy of this Legacy Reanimator deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Ashen Rider, Griselbrand, and Elesh Norn, and then bring them back into play with cards like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Exhume. The deck also includes disruption cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's resources and protect its own game plan. With the ability to quickly cheat out powerful threats from the graveyard, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through powerful combos and reanimation shenanigans.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, along with versatile creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Snapcaster Mage. It also includes a suite of powerful control spells such as Council's Judgment, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to manipulate the board state using cards like Terminus and Entreat the Angels, while maintaining card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. It also includes mana fixing with Arcum's Astrolabe and powerful counterspells like Dovin's Veto and Force of Negation.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board with aggressive plays through cheap counterspells and removal, while utilizing the power of efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Stifle and Daze, while also providing card advantage and consistency with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. By generating early pressure and maintaining tempo advantage with cards like Wrenn and Six, Canadian Threshold aims to close out games quickly before opponents can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive goblins onto the battlefield using cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of goblin creatures and deal damage quickly before the opponent can establish their game plan. Key cards like Goblin Chieftain and Goblin Warchief provide buffs to all goblins, while others like Grenzo, Dungeon Warden and Goblin Ringleader help maintain card advantage and board presence. The deck also includes removal like Goblin Cratermaker and Grenzo to deal with threats from the opponent.
